title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor
description: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor.
OB: The observed behavior is that when selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the Java editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: This behavior seems odd, as reverting the file contents should not take longer than simply closing and reopening the file.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1) Open an editor on the file 'org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java' from the source folder 'Eclipse SWT Custom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository.
2) Select the end of the first line and enter a space character to mark the file as dirty.
3) On a fast machine, it takes about 8 seconds to perform the following steps:
   a) Click on the close box in the editor tab.
   b) Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog.
   c) Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
4) However, if steps 1) and 2) are repeated and then 'Revert' is selected from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
